text: John, Joe, Sarah are in the park playing football and enjoying the sunny weather. They stop to have some lunch. John has 3 apples in his lunchbox. Joe has 2 apples in his lunchbox. Joe is feeling generous and gives 2 apples to John. Sarah also has 9 apples in her lunchbox. John is full and gives 4 apples to Sarah. How many apples does John now have?

John, Joe, Sarah are hungry and decide they want to go eat some lunch. They go to their favorite restaurant nearby and decide to order pizza. John takes 2 slices of pizza. Joe loves pizza and decides to take 4 slices of pizza. Sarah then takes the final 2 pizzas. Joe is feeling generous and gives 1 pizza to John. Sarah is also feeling generous and gives 1 pizza to John. How many pizzas did John eat?
John has 5 apples and his friend gave him 3 more. How many apples does John have now?
A library currently has 10 books. The librarian orders 20 more books. How many books does the library have?
There are 25 birds that are currently sitting on a tree. It starts to rain and 10 of them fly away. How many birds are there left on the tree?
A boy has 8 marbles. The boy gives 3 marbles away. How many marbles does the boy have now?
John has 5 boxes of chocolates, each box contains 10 chocolates. How many chocolates does John have in total?
A school has 4 classes, each class has 25 students. How many students are there in total at the school?
There are 24 cookies to share equally among 6 children. How many cookies will each child get?
A teacher has 36 pencils to share equally among 9 students. How many pencils will each student get?
